help_description: The short name of the sample.
Total number of read pairs that were assigned to this library in demultiplexing.

alert_warn_detail: This could indicate poor tissue alignment. If necessary, please use manual alignment via the Loupe Browser.
alert_warn_name: High Fraction Squares Under Tissue Outside Microsope Image Coordinates
help_description: Fraction of squares with corrdinates outside microscope image dimensions.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 65%. This may indicate a quality issue with the R1 read for the Visium Chemistry. Application performance may be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction Valid Barcodes
help_description: Fraction of reads with barcodes that match the whitelist after barcode correction.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 75%. This may indicate a quality issue with the Illumina R1 read for the Visium Chemistry. Application performance may be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction Valid Gene Expression UMIs
help_description: Fraction of reads with valid UMIs; i.e. UMI sequences that do not contain Ns and that are not homopolymers.

The fraction of reads originating from an already-observed UMI. This is a function of library complexity and sequencing depth. More specifically, this is the fraction of confidently mapped, valid square-barcode, valid UMI reads that had a non-unique square-barcode/UMI/gene combination.

alert_warn_detail: Fraction of square barcode bases with Q-score >= 30 should be above 55%. A lower fraction might indicate poor sequencing quality.
alert_warn_name: Fraction of square barcode bases with Q-score >= 30 is low
help_description: Fraction of square barcode bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.

alert_warn_detail: Fraction of RNA read bases with Q-score >= 30 should be above 65%. A lower fraction might indicate poor sequencing quality.
alert_warn_name: Fraction of RNA read bases with Q-score >= 30 is low
help_description: Fraction of RNA read bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator. This is Read 2 for the Visium v1 chemistry.

alert_warn_detail: Fraction of UMI bases with Q-score >= 30 should be above 75%. A lower fraction might indicate poor sequencing quality.
alert_warn_name: Fraction of UMI bases with Q-score >= 30 is low
help_description: Fraction of UMI bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.
Fraction of reads that mapped to the genome.
Fraction of reads that mapped uniquely to the genome. If a gene mapped to exonic loci from a single gene and also to non-exonic loci, it is considered uniquely mapped to one of the exonic loci.

full_name: Reads Mapped Confidently to Intergenic Regions
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped uniquely to an intergenic region of the genome.

full_name: Reads Mapped Confidently to Intronic Regions
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped uniquely to an intronic region of the genome.

full_name: Reads Mapped Confidently to Exonic Regions
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped uniquely to an exonic region of the genome.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 30%. This can indicate use of the wrong reference transcriptome, a reference transcriptome with overlapping genes, poor library quality, poor sequencing quality, or reads shorter than the recommended minimum. Application performance may be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction Reads Confidently Mapped To Transcriptome
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped to a unique gene in the transcriptome. The read must be consistent with annotated splice junctions. These reads are considered for UMI counting.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal < 10%. This can indicate use of an unsupported chemistry type. Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_warn_name: High Fraction of Reads Mapped Antisense to Genes
help_description: Fraction of reads confidently mapped to the transcriptome, but on the opposite strand of their annotated gene. A read is counted as antisense if it has any alignments that are consistent with an exon of a transcript but antisense to it, and has no sense alignments.

full_name: Fraction Reads in Squares Under Tissue
alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 50%. Application performance may be affected. Many of the reads were not assigned to tissue covered squares. This could be caused by high levels of ambient RNA resulting from inefficient permeabilization, because the incorrect image was used, or because of poor tissue detection. The latter case can be addressed by using the manual tissue selection option through Loupe. Ignore this alert if you manually selected a subset of the tissue in the capture area, such as a single core punch in a TMA.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction Gene Expression Reads in Squares
help_description: The fraction of valid-barcode, confidently-mapped reads with tissue-associated barcodes.
The number of genes with at least one UMI count in any tissue covered square.

alert_warn_detail: Inspect the image alignment for possible errors
alert_warn_name: full_name
help_description: full_name

alert_warn_detail: The automatic UMI-based registration could not determine a confident offset, so the position of the UMIs relative to the image has not been adjusted. If you do in fact observe misalignment between the high-resolution H&E and UMI images, please consider manually adjusting the alignment using the --umi-to-image-offset parameter.
alert_warn_name: full_name
help_description: full_name

alert_warn_detail: An error occured during the automatic UMI-based registration between the high-resolution H&E and UMI images and the results may be inaccurate. If you do in fact observe misalignment between the high-resolution H&E and UMI images, please consider manually adjusting the alignment using the --umi-to-image-offset parameter.
alert_warn_name: full_name
help_description: full_name

alert_warn_detail: The image may be rotated or mirrored. Please inspect and re-run with the --reorient-images option if the orientation is incorrect.
alert_warn_name: full_name
help_description: full_name

alert_warn_detail: At least one nucleus detected is larger than the maximum diameter of nuclei in pixels. Consider increasing the maximum nucleus diameter using the CLI parameter max_nucleus_diameter_px.
alert_warn_name: Detected large nuclei
help_description: At least one nucleus detected is larger than the maximum diameter of nuclei in pixels. Consider increasing the maximum nucleus diameter using the CLI parameter max_nucleus_diameter_px.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal >20. This usually indicates poor tissue detection, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_warn_detail_cs: Ideal > 20. This usually indicates poor tissue detection, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_warn_name: Unusual Number of Squares Detected
help_description: The number of barcodes associated with a square under tissue.
The total number of sequenced reads divided by the number of barcodes associated with a square under tissue.
Total number of Antibody library reads.
The total number of sequenced Antibody library reads divided by the number of barcodes associated with a square under tissue.
Fraction of Antibody library reads with a barcode found in or corrected to one that is found in the whitelist.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 75%. This may indicate a quality issue with the Illumina R1 read for the Visium Chemistry. Application performance may be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction Valid Antibody UMIs
help_description: Fraction of Antibody library reads with valid UMIs.

The fraction of Antibody library reads originating from an already-observed UMI. This is a function of library complexity and sequencing depth. More specifically, this is the fraction of confidently mapped, square under tissue-associated barcode, valid UMI reads that had a non-unique (square under tissue-associated barcode, UMI, Antibody feature barcode).
Fraction of Antibody library barcode bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.
Fraction of Antibody library read bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.
Fraction of Antibody library read 2 bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.
Fraction of Antibody library UMI bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.
Fraction of Antibody library reads that contain a recognized antibody barcode.
Median UMIs per Square (summed over all recognized antibody barcodes).

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 65%. Suggests suboptimal sample preparation, low quality tissue, biology that does not present panel epitopes or errors in the feature reference CSV.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction of Antibody Reads Usable
help_description: Fraction of Antibody library reads that contain a recognized antibody barcode, a valid UMI, and a square under tissue-associated barcode.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 65%. Application performance may be affected. Many of the antibody reads were not assigned to tissue covered squares. This could be caused by inefficient permeabilization, because the incorrect image was used, or because of poor tissue detection. The latter case can be addressed by using the manual tissue selection option through Loupe.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction Antibody Reads Under Tissue
help_description: Among Antibody library reads with a recognized antibody barcode, a valid UMI, and a valid barcode, the number associated with a square under tissue.

full_name: Antibody Reads in Squares Under Tissue
help_description: Among Antibody library reads with a recognized antibody barcode, a valid UMI, and a valid barcode, the fraction associated with a square under tissue.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal < 65%. Suggests suboptimal sample preparation, low quality tissue, biology that does not present panel epitopes or errors in the feature reference CSV.
alert_warn_name: High fraction unrecognized antibody reads
help_description: Among all Antibody library reads, the fraction with an unrecognizable antibody barcode.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal >0.5. High correlation between isotype and non-isotype antibodies indicates that isotype controls are useful for normalizing antibody counts. Correlation below this level suggests that the antibody counts in the raw feature barcode matrix should be used instead of the normalized antibody counts in the filtered feature barcode matrix.
alert_warn_detail_cs: Ideal >0.5. High correlation between isotype and non-isotype antibodies indicates that isotype controls are useful for normalizing antibody counts. Correlation below this level suggests that the antibody counts in the raw feature barcode matrix should be used instead of the normalized antibody counts in the filtered feature barcode matrix.
alert_warn_name: Low Correlation Between Isotype and Non-Isotype Antibodies
help_description: Isotype vs. non-isotype correlation
Flag if isotype normalization was used (Default True)
Total number of read pairs that were assigned to these libraries in demultiplexing.
Number of read pairs after normalizing for depth among multiple libraries.
The fraction of reads kept for this input sample, after normalizing depth across samples to reduce batch effects.
The mean number of total sequencing reads per square in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.

full_name: Pre-Normalization Confidently Mapped Barcoded Reads per Square
help_description: The mean number of confidently-mapped, valid-barcode reads per square in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 50%. There may be large differences in sequencing depth across the input libraries. Application performance may be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Post-Normalization Read Depth
help_description: The fraction of reads kept for this input sample, after normalizing depth across samples to reduce batch effects.
The total number of sequenced reads divided by the number of barcodes associated with a tissue-covered square.
The total number of (depth-normalized) reads divided by the number of barcodes associated with a tissue-covered square.
The fraction of reads kept for this input sample, after normalizing depth across samples to reduce batch effects.
The mean number of total sequencing reads per square in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.

full_name: Pre-Normalization Confidently Mapped Barcoded Reads per Square
help_description: The mean number of confidently-mapped, valid-barcode reads per square in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.
The fraction of reads kept for this input sample, after normalizing depth across samples to reduce batch effects.
The mean number of total sequencing reads per square in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.

full_name: Pre-Normalization Confidently Mapped Barcoded Reads per Square
help_description: The mean number of confidently-mapped, valid-barcode reads per square in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.
The fraction of reads kept for this input sample, after normalizing depth across samples to reduce batch effects.
The mean number of total sequencing reads per square in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.

full_name: Pre-Normalization Confidently Mapped Barcoded Reads per Square
help_description: The mean number of confidently-mapped, valid-barcode reads per square in this input sample, prior to depth normalization.
Before chemistry batch correction, the average fraction of 100 nearest neighbors belonging to the same batch, normalized by the expected value without batch effect.

The number of targeted genes with at least one UMI count in any tissue covered square.

full_name: Reads Mapped Confidently to the Transcriptome
alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 30%. This can indicate use of a small panel with low aggregate expression, use of the wrong target panel, or inefficient targeting. Targeted performance may be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction Reads Confidently Mapped To Targeted Transcriptome
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped to a unique targeted gene in the transcriptome. The read must be consistent with annotated splice junctions. These reads are considered for UMI counting.

full_name: Reads Mapped Confidently to the Targeted Transcriptome
alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 30%. This can indicate use of a small panel with low aggregate expression, use of the wrong target panel, or inefficient targeting. Targeted performance may be affected.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction Reads Confidently Mapped To Targeted Transcriptome
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped to a unique targeted gene in the transcriptome. The read must be consistent with annotated splice junctions. These reads are considered for UMI counting.

full_name: Reads Mapped Confidently to the Non-targeted Transcriptome
help_description: Fraction of reads that mapped to a unique gene in the transcriptome. The read must be consistent with annotated splice junctions. These reads are considered for UMI counting. This fraction is computed separately for targeted and non-targeted gene categories.

full_name: Fraction of Reads Removed by UMI Filtering
help_description: Fraction of all reads confidently mapped to the targeted transcriptome and subsequently removed by targeted UMI filtering.

full_name: Reads per UMI threshold for UMI filtering
help_description: Minimum number of reads per UMI required to pass UMI filtering. UMIs in targeted genes with read support (strictly) lower than this threshold are filtered out. UMI filtering is not applied to non-targeted genes.

help_description: Number of 2µm squares coverd by tissue.

alert_warn_detail: Cell segmentation was enabled, but no cells with at least 1 UMI were detected. Please check your tissue detection, tissue registration and, if provided, your tissue selection Loupe file.

alert_warn_detail: Cell segmentation was enabled, but no cells with at least 1 UMI were detected. Please check your tissue detection, tissue registration and, if provided, your tissue selection Loupe file.

help_description: full_name

alert_warn_detail: Ideal < 0.5μm/pixel. Microscope image pixel size is above the recommended threshold (0.5μm/pixel). Segmentation results may be less accurate. Verify that the image has not been downsampled.
alert_warn_name: Large microscope image pixel size

key: # Things to take out from the SD Visium

alert_warn_detail: Ideal >20. This usually indicates poor tissue detection, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_warn_detail_cs: Ideal > 20. This usually indicates poor tissue detection, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_warn_name: Unusual Number of Squares Detected
help_description: The number of barcodes associated with a square under tissue.
The number of reads, both under and outside of tissue, divided by the number of barcodes associated with a square under tissue.
The number of reads, both under and outside of tissue, divided by the number of barcodes associated with a square under tissue.
The fraction of the squares under the tissue.

full_name: Mean Reads Under Tissue per Square
alert_warn_detail: Modifying the parameter --rps-limit is not recommended. Please refer to the documentation.
alert_warn_name: High Reads Under Tissue per Square
help_description: The number of reads under tissue divided by the number of barcodes associated with a square under tissue.
The median number of genes detected per square under tissue-associated barcode. Detection is defined as the presence of at least 1 UMI count.
The median number of UMI counts per tissue covered square.
The median number of genes detected per square under tissue-associated barcode. Detection is defined as the presence of at least 1 UMI count.
The median number of targeted UMI counts per tissue-associated barcode.
Number of genes with at least 10 filtered UMIs from tissue-associated barcodes. These genes are used to calculate per-gene enrichments.
